news_header: NASA astronaut Suni Williams conducted a spacewalk after being on the ISS for seven months, while awaiting a delayed return to Earth due to technical issues.
news_text: NASA astronaut Suni Williams, along with Butch Wilmore, performed a spacewalk on the International Space Station (ISS) after a seven-month stay. Their return to Earth has been postponed to late March or April 2024 due to technical problems with their spacecraft. During the six-hour spacewalk, Williams and fellow astronaut Nick Hague conducted maintenance tasks, including equipment repairs and preparations for future work on the Alpha Magnetic Spectrometer. Williams is scheduled for another spacewalk on January 23, 2024. Despite the delays, the astronauts continue their work aboard the ISS.
